answers.answer: From an X Air Force girl, you better corner that doc up girl!!! Dont you let them ship you out until you feel like a million....SERIOUSLY!!!!  You have alot going on.  I really dont think she would've put you on the medication to treat Lupus if she didnt think you had it.  Slow down and at least make sure you are well for at least 6 months or a year before you even let them consider shipping you anywhere.  You get off in the desert and let that disease get ahold of you and it would be just awful.  Unless, they are gonna send you somewhere good or something and you will have access to another rhuemy real close.  I'd just be really sure, ya know...but one thing is for real sure...You wanna pin em down on that dx cuz when you get out, they aren't really good at giving you them records.  Trust me, take a copy with you and put it in a safe place.  I can't get ahold of a dx I got in the AF, they don't wanna disable me with it.....just watch your own back....K  Take Care...Amy

Deep in my soul I think you are definitely positive for Lupus, just based on your symptoms.  The reason the doc has your next appt. so far out is due to the fact that Plaquenil can take up to 5-6 months to show improvement in your health.  I just started Plaquenil on June 24th, and I don't have another appt. until Sept. 24th.  She is wanting to see if it's working at all for me.  and it is!!!  I'm excited.  Have your symptoms abated at all since you've been on Plaquenil???    It's very hard to have a positive diagnosis of Lupus.  The fact that you were diagnosed the first time you saw a Rheumy tells me your results were VERY positive.  Now you need to see if you can stay inthe AF with that!  If so, you're lucky.  You will have medical coverage for the rest of your life, if you get to stay in.  If they want to boot you, it has to be for a disability, and that means you MIGHT get paid your current salary for the rest of your life!  I am not positive how that works.  Anyway, start checking on military disability laws and check with your military legal eagles.  One of the things I am finding that the scientists are contributing to the cause of Lupus is viruses or infections.  I had a stomach infection called Halicobactor Pylori in 1999, and started getting the Lupus symptoms right after that.  And they are finding the vast majority of Lupus sufferers had that or Mono at some point in their lives.  I went 9 years without a true diagnoses!  Be thankful things are moving so "fast" for you.  Good luck.  And I highly doubt you'll get to deploy to a desert area.  You'll find that most Lupus sufferers CANNOT be in the sun!  AT ALL!  Even in cold weather.  And no tanning booths either.  Also, light bulbs that are UV must have covers on them or you'll get symptoms!  And in some areas of the world, your electric company will give you a break on electric bills if you have a doctors note stating that higher heat will make you swell or have any medical issues.  Grab the silver lining and give the plaquenil some chance to help you.

Hey Dallasgyl -Oh yeah, I would Definatley say you have lupus...you have far more than the four criteria that are required, and thats only knowing ONE of your blood tests!!  Zmom was also very correct in saying (though you proabably think this sounds crazy) that you are lucky to have been Dxd so fast.  The average lupus Dx takes 3-6 YEARS!!  And that includes people who are REALLY sick....The plaquenil does take up to 5 months to work (it works great, though), and it is not abnormal for your doc to not need to see you until then, unless you get sick.I would get the doc on the phone ASAP, and I would not be deployed anywhere if you can help it.  GIve your body time on the medication so you will be feeling better...You DO NOT want to go into a flare somewhere where they have no clue about lupus, you know?  Also, you need to stay out of the sun...The UVA/UVB rays in the sun trigger the actual antibodies in our blood that are responsible for attacking our healthy cells.  Stay protected at all times....Keep us posted on how you make out.  I am glad you got such a quick Dx...believe me, you do not want to be sick for years with docs looking at you like youre crazy...Take care and keep us posted!Lauri

Hey, I'm a lupie vet. You gotta make sure to get copies of your records. You're not deployable until they get your lupus under control. I don't remember the reg, but it says you can't be deployed if you're under the care of a physician, and you are. If you do get clearance, though, you can't go anyplace exotic (or sunny) because you have to stay close to a doc and can't do anything which will cause a flair. They'll probably tell you you'll be med-boarded out, but I wasn't. It's your choice, but in my experience, if you tell the med-board you want to stay, and that you can do the work and all, they'll let you, just under a P4 profile.

Thanks guys for your responses.....i really appreciate it.  Okay so i see now why she would set the apt so far away but i still dont get why start me on meds without an actual diagnosis.  She should have just diagnosed me then right?  according to her i wont get my concrete diagnosis until 30 sept.  I dont know its just confusing to me because would if my test come back and its something else and shes had me on plaquenil.   She even went on telling me that i have to take this everyday for the rest of my life and stressed to me and my husband to make sure i continue to take it seriously.  im  guessing is that what everyone gets started on after seein a rhemy?  So many questions...lol...tctrumpet ,See i didnt know that at all.  My primary is aware that im seeing a rhemy but they havent put me on a profile or anything which leave me vunerable to get tasked to deploy and thats exactly what happened.  She did tell me that after my apt on the 30th with my rhemy that they wanted to start an MEB on me.  Well im supposed to leave in Dec so im like what now.  Im gonna find out if Im still eligable to deploy while inthe process of an MEB.  I know someone else who couldnt PCS due to an on going MEB but i dont know how they treat deployments.  I know that i cant be in the sun and yeah i tend swell after that but what about deploying in the winter?  Im afraid they will blow me off because i wont be in the heat.  Its not even that i dont want to deploy i just dont think the timing is right ya know.  Im just lost and none of my docs are giving me answers.....but thanks and i'll keep u posted!

Hey, how are you doing? My name is Anatalie and I recently started a nonprofit organization called Hope with Lupus Foundation, Inc. I was reading our story that you wrote a few years ago and I am curious to know what your health is like now. I pray all is well with you and your family.

Hey, how are you doing? My name is Anatalie and I recently started a nonprofit organization called Hope with Lupus Foundation, Inc. I was reading our story that you wrote a few years ago and I am curious to know what your health is like now. I pray all is well with you and your family.

why can't people with lupus enlist in the military i was diagnosed 3 years ago and all i want to do is be a marine but i have not had a flare up and the amount of training i do well i should not be breathing right now so i don't understand what the problem is i have gotten really depressed because of and nobody can give me a legitimate answer can you guys clear the air for me?
Only thing I can think of would be that you have to be world wide deployable. Anything that would restrict that would most likely render you ineligible.

question: Hi and thanks for checkin out my post.  heres whats going on...im currently in the Air force and for the past two years i've been having a lot of health issues.  First off  i started to swell...feet, hands, knees..i know weired huh, and i broke out with what i know now in hives.  I have been constanstly tired..im talkin all the time!  not only that, i have lost alot of hair to the point to where im hiding bald spots.  To everyone else i appear fine but alot of the time i feel like ****.  The only person that really knows is my husband.  I tend to swell when im stressed and if i have been in the heat.  Is anyone else like that?  I also get headaches alot that make me moody. :(  My primary care physician in the military blew me off for the longest and everytime i would swell i would just come in and get steroids...sometimes the shot depending on how bad it was.   i  akso started to get sick alot.  Im talkin i was catching everything or so it seemed.  This last straw was when i caught MRSA.  yeah not so fun i had a big abcess that took 2 1/2 weeks to heal after being drained and packed for days.....well they finally listened and took heed to my complaints that something isnt right and did an ANA.  All i know is that is was positive from what he said and he sent me to a rhemytologist in July.  Okay so i get to the rhemy and she says it looks real LUPUs'ish based of my symptoms and docs notes.  She did a bunch of blood work and had some x rays done, also did a urine test.  She did a physical exam and noted that i had a mouth ulser associated with lupus and edema?!  She asked if i have kids and i told her i had a miscarriage in 06 and a premature baby in 07 at 33 wk due to severe preeclampsia.  She told me that alot of people with lupus tend to get preeclampsia during pregnancy and are at higher risk for miscarriage.  she explained how lupus "could" have been the reason for my eventfull pregnancy.  well she started me on plaquenil and set my follow up for sep 30.  Im like why so far out!!!  then she told me that if something was wrong she would call me.  Well i havent received any calls so now im confused....do i have lupus or not.  and why start treatment if you dont know what i have?!  should i just assume i dont have it since she never called or what?  I mean i dont know anything!!!  But the big thing is i have just been tasked to deploy and i have to be medically cleared.  Since im in the care of a specialist my military doc has to get the okay from her to clear me but she is super hard to reach!  im just ready to get this diagnosing stuff over with.  i have anxiety cause i just dont know whats going to happen.  What does it seem like to you guys?  Sorry so long but your patients is really appreaciated...please advise :)
title: in the military with possible lupus!!!!  i just dont know what this could be!!!  Please help....
